pages.text: Basin is a processing device. It comes with two variants: wooden and earthen. Earthen Basin also has 16 variants in all colors found in vanilla color palette. Basin has three working modes: $(l:processing/basin#distillation)"distillation"$(), $(l:processing/basin#squeezing)"squeezing"$() and $(l:processing/basin#throwing)"contact"$().
"Contact" simply means that you just throw items (press $(k:drop))into basin, and it will mix up with fluid inside the basin and become another item.

"Distillation" means that you need to heat the fluid inside the basin to get refined products. Only earthen basin are capable to handle distillation. To heat fluid, you need a heat source. Typical heat sources include lava and fire. It can be sunlight if enabled in config.

Squeezing is a bit complicated. It means that you need to put items into basin by right clicking basin, then either put a vanilla piston on the basin to form a squeezer (see diagram on your right), or use your feet to crush them by let yourself jump and fall on the basin.$(br)The squeezer structure only needs redstone pulse to work.
Unlike its earthen counterpart, wooden basin has only one variant: the one with oak wood texture.
Want colored basins? Replace terracotta with colored terracotta. Although technically this entry ends here, if you feel bored, you can still browse the rest of pages of this entry.
